channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [KAFKA-15330] Migration from ZK to KRaft works with 3.4 but fails from 3.5 upwards
item.description:
We recently did some migration testing from our old ZK-based kafka clusters to KRaft while still being on kafka 3.4. The migration tests succeeded at first try. In the meantime we updated to kafka 3.5/3.5.1 and now we wanted to continue our migration work, which ran into unexpected problems.

On the controller we get messages like:

Aug 10 06:49:33 kafkactl01 kafka-server-start.sh[48572]: [2023-08-10 06:49:33,072] INFO [KRaftMigrationDriver id=495] Still waiting for all controller nodes ready to begin the migration. due to: Missing apiVersion from nodes: [514, 760] (org.apache.kafka.metadata.migration.KRaftMigrationDriver)

On the broker side, we see:

06:52:56,109] INFO [BrokerLifecycleManager id=6 isZkBroker=true] Unable to register the broker because the RPC got timed out before it could be sent. (kafka.server.BrokerLifecycleManager)

If we reinstall the same development cluster with kafka 3.4, using the exact same steps provided by your migration documentation (only difference is using inter.broker.protocol.version=3.4 instead of inter.broker.protocol.version=3.5), everything works as expected. Updating to kafka 3.5/3.5.1 yields the same problems.

Testing is done on a three-node kafka cluster with a three-node zookeeper ensemble and a three-node controller setup.

Besides our default configuration containing the active zookeeper hosts etc., this is what was added on the brokers:

# Migration
advertised.listeners=PLAINTEXT://kafka03:9092
listener.security.protocol.map=PLAINTEXT:PLAINTEXT,CONTROLLER:PLAINTEXT
zookeeper.metadata.migration.enable=true
controller.quorum.voters=495@kafkactl01:9093,760@kafkactl02:9093,514@kafkactl03:9093
controller.listener.names=CONTROLLER

The main controller config looks like this:

process.roles=controller
node.id=495
controller.quorum.voters=495@kafkactl01:9093,760@kafkactl02:9093,514@kafkactl03:9093
listeners=CONTROLLER://:9093
inter.broker.listener.name=PLAINTEXT
controller.listener.names=CONTROLLER
listener.security.protocol.map=CONTROLLER:PLAINTEXT,PLAINTEXT:PLAINTEXT
zookeeper.metadata.migration.enable=true

Both configs contain the identical zookeeper.connect settings, everything is setup automatically so it should be identical on every run and we can reliably reproduce migration success on kafka 3.4 and migration failure using the same setup with kafka 3.5.

There are other issues mentioning problems with ApiVersions like KAFKA-15230 - not quite sure if this is a duplicate of the underlying problem there.
item.environment:
Debian Bookworm/12.1
kafka 3.4 and 3.5 / scala 2.13
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 17.0.8+7-Debian-1deb12u1)
item.summary: Migration from ZK to KRaft works with 3.4 but fails from 3.5 upwards

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: In addition I did the same tests using 3.6.0-SNAPSHOT from the github mirror (commit 9318b591d7a57b9db1e7519986d78f0402cd5b5e) - this ends up with the same behaviour as 3.5.

Re-ran the tests today with a snapshot build of commit cdbc9a8d88c1ddc9dd088a33d047783a5b13c282 from the github mirror as there are a few new commits regarding ApiVersion handling - migration seems to work again.
This seems likely to be a duplicate of KAFKA-15230. Can you confirm that your cluster remains stuck in ZkMigrationState = 2 (pre-migration state)?

I tried the migration in our staging environment today, using the final 3.6.0 release of kafka - the brokers report zkmigrationstate=4, the controllers report zkmigrationstate=2. I'm still seeing the same errors:

 2022023-10-12 14:51:17[2023-10-12 12:51:17,810] WARN [KRaftMigrationDriver id=67] Still waiting for all controller nodes ready to begin the migration. Not ready due to: Missing apiVersion from nodes: [87] (org.apache.kafka.metadata.migration.KRaftMigrationDriver)3-10-12 14:51:17[2023-10-12 12:51:17,810] WARN [KRaftMigrationDriver id=67] Still waiting for all controller nodes ready to begin the migration. Not ready due to: Missing apiVersion from nodes: [87] (org.apache.kafka.metadata.migration.KRaftMigrationDriver)

2023-10-12 14:50:36[2023-10-12 12:50:36,385] INFO [BrokerLifecycleManager id=2 isZkBroker=true] Unable to register the broker because the RPC got timed out before it could be sent. (kafka.server.BrokerLifecycleManager)2023-10-12 14:50:40[2023-10-12 12:50:40,384] INFO [BrokerLifecycleManager id=4 isZkBroker=true] Unable to register the broker because the RPC got timed out before it could be sent. (kafka.server.BrokerLifecycleManager)2023-10-12 14:50:43[2023-10-12 12:50:43,662] INFO [BrokerLifecycleManager id=3 isZkBroker=true] Unable to register the broker because the RPC got timed out before it could be sent. (kafka.server.BrokerLifecycleManager)2023-10-12 14:50:58[2023-10-12 12:50:58,483] INFO [BrokerLifecycleManager id=6 isZkBroker=true] Unable to register the broker because the RPC got timed out before it could be sent. (kafka.server.BrokerLifecycleManager)2023-10-12 14:51:00[2023-10-12 12:51:00,332] INFO [BrokerLifecycleManager id=5 isZkBroker=true] Unable to register the broker because the RPC got timed out before it could be sent. (kafka.server.BrokerLifecycleManager)2023-10-12 14:51:13[2023-10-12 12:51:13,853] INFO [BrokerLifecycleManager id=1 isZkBroker=true] Unable to register the broker because the RPC got timed out before it could be sent. (kafka.server.BrokerLifecycleManager)

Another observation from our staging environment after I redeployed the controller nodes: initially, the KRaftMigrationDriver only reports "No known brokers" because of the failing registration from the broker nodes. When I restart the controllers, the error mentioned above (Not ready due to: Missing apiVersion from nodes) starts to show up. In addition, with DEBUG logging enabled, the following is showing up:

[2023-10-17 08:16:32,485] DEBUG [zk-broker-1-to-controller-alter-partition-channel-manager]: No controller provided, retrying after backoff (kafka.server.BrokerToControllerRequestThread)

Can you attach non-sensitive parts of your broker and controller configs to this ticket?

One possibility is a mis-match of MetadataVersion (formerly IBP) between the controller and the brokers. When registering with the KRaft controller, the ZK brokers need to be on the same MetadataVersion that the controller was bootstrapped with.

For example, when you bootstrap the controller you get the latest MetadataVersion unless you specify otherwise.

./bin/kafka-storage.sh format --cluster-id sJLl5Bp7QOSZMs37jir-cA --config config/kraft/controller.properties
Formatting /tmp/kraft-controller-logs with metadata.version 3.7-IV0.

Or with the "--release-version" flag

./bin/kafka-storage.sh format --cluster-id sJLl5Bp7QOSZMs37jir-cA --config config/kraft/controller.properties --release-version 3.6
Formatting /tmp/kraft-controller-logs with metadata.version 3.6-IV2.

This metadata version must match the "inter.broker.protocol.version" property used by the brokers.

I attached what's being used while migrating - broker.properties and controller.properties.

I reran the migration test in our staging environment, formatting the controller nodes explicitly with -r 3.6. The brokers are using inter.broker.protocol.version=3.6. This should match. But still on the controller node:

[KRaftMigrationDriver id=87] No brokers are known to KRaft, waiting for brokers to register. (org.apache.kafka.metadata.migration.KRaftMigrationDriver)

and on the broker side:

[BrokerLifecycleManager id=1 isZkBroker=true] Unable to register the broker because the RPC got timed out before it could be sent. (kafka.server.BrokerLifecycleManager)

As the setup is provisioned via configuration management, the working setup in the test environment is identical besides that the test cluster is almost empty despite an empty test topic. The staging cluster has topics containing data and has been continuously upgraded since we started using kafka a few years ago up until kafka 3.6. There must be a little detail I am missing.

After the release of kafka 3.7 I reran the migration tests in our staging environment and I am still seeing the same problems. The quorum is assembled:

[KRaftMigrationDriver id=87] Controller Quorum is ready for Zk to KRaft migration. Now waiting for ZK brokers. (org.apache.kafka.metadata.migration.KRaftMigrationDriver)
[KRaftMigrationDriver id=87] 87 transitioning from WAIT_FOR_CONTROLLER_QUORUM to WAIT_FOR_BROKERS state (org.apache.kafka.metadata.migration.KRaftMigrationDriver)

but still on the controller side:

[KRaftMigrationDriver id=87] No brokers are known to KRaft, waiting for brokers to register. (org.apache.kafka.metadata.migration.KRaftMigrationDriver)

and on the broker side:

[BrokerLifecycleManager id=1 isZkBroker=true] Unable to register the broker because the RPC got timed out before it could be sent. (kafka.server.BrokerLifecycleManager)

I did a new custom build of kafka (the HEAD being github mirror commit 1e9d0c4cd25876c44b2e579d9d5e99746cbf660b) and re-ran the migration. This time the metadata migration did succeed:

[2024-06-03 11:59:07,104] INFO [KRaftMigrationDriver id=87] Completed migration of metadata from ZooKeeper to KRaft. 1460 records were generated in 2089 ms across 8 batches. The average time spent waiting on a batch was 68.63 ms. The record types were {TOPIC_RECORD=114, PARTITION_RECORD=1079, CONFIG_RECORD=266, PRODUCER_IDS_RECORD=1}. The current metadata offset is now 3294 with an epoch of 1. Saw 6 brokers in the migrated metadata [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]. (org.apache.kafka.metadata.migration.KRaftMigrationDriver)

If the controller is not seeing the ZK brokers get registered, check that the IBP of those brokers matches the MV that the controller quorum was provisioned with. You can also turn up logging on the controller to look for details on why the brokers aren't getting registered.
I have the same issue on Kafka 3.6.1
Finally, with kafka 3.7.1 all migrations were successfully finished on our kafka clusters.

rsommer , how did you manage to make the migration successful? For us, with 3.7.1 we have this issue KAFKA-17146 . Did you have any authentication, SCRAM, SSL enabled in your cluster? Maybe something fails silently during the migration and we don't notice it. Can you post here the configuration in the brokers and in the KRAFT controllers?
saimon46 our config is basically what I attached earlier in this ticket. As the affected clusters run in an isolated environment, we refrained from additional measures like auth/SCRAM/SSL.

I completely agree in having a clean cluster for the migration without any AUTH/SCRAM/SSL. The problem is that remove all these extra configs will require a short downtime before and after the migration. I can give a try with a cluster without any auth, but find a way to have basic PLAINTEXT protocol unauthenticated.

Closing since it is not recommended to perform a migration on 3.4 or 3.5.

 

3.6.2 and 3.7.1, and 3.8.0 are the recommended versions.
